These symptoms have been progressively worsening over the past six months, significantly impacting his daily activities and quality of life.

Additionally, a short course of oral prednisone was attempted, but it only provided temporary relief without addressing the underlying inflammation.

Based on the severity of symptoms and the inadequate response to initial treatments, the treating rheumatologist has recommended starting a biological disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (bDMARD) therapy. The chosen medication is Adalimumab, which has shown efficacy in managing moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis in numerous clinical trials.
The patient's condition has not responded adequately to over-the-counter anti-inflammatory medications and lifestyle modifications.
